sensory_systems.name: Advanced Radio Frequency (RF) Sensing Arrays
sensory_systems.description: Dense arrays of miniature RF sensors integrated into base stations and distributed throughout the network. These sensors will continuously monitor network congestion, signal quality, interference, and user behavior in real-time. They will utilize a combination of passive and active sensing techniques.

specifications.resolution: 1mm x 1mm spatial resolution for interference mapping, 10kHz frequency resolution.
specifications.coverage_area: 10m radius per sensor, scalable via dense deployment.
specifications.accuracy: ± 0.5 dBm for signal strength, ± 1kHz for frequency accuracy, ± 1% accuracy for interference measurement.
specifications.data_rate: 10 Mbps per sensor for data transmission.

sensory_systems.name: Passive Optical Sensors (POS)
sensory_systems.description: POS will be deployed alongside fiber optic cables to passively monitor network performance, temperature, humidity, and vibrations. They will provide detailed insights into the physical infrastructure's health.

sensory_systems.name: Digital Twin RF Sensors
sensory_systems.description: Low-cost, software-defined RF sensors deployed alongside existing infrastructure to create a continuous, real-time digital representation of the network's radio environment.

control_systems.name: AI-Powered Network Orchestration Engine
control_systems.description: A central AI engine utilizing reinforcement learning to dynamically allocate network slices based on real-time demand, quality-of-service (QoS) requirements, and network conditions.

control_systems.name: Adaptive Resource Management (ARM) System
control_systems.description: A distributed control system utilizing model predictive control (MPC) to optimize resource allocation across network slices.

specifications.data_input: RF sensor data, user behavior data

control_systems.name: Federated Control Loop
control_systems.description: Decentralized control utilizing blockchain technology to ensure secure and transparent slice management across multiple network operators.

mechanical_systems.name: Modular Base Station Units (BSUs)
mechanical_systems.description: Standardized, modular BSUs incorporating advanced antenna arrays and power amplifiers, facilitating rapid deployment and scaling.

mechanical_systems.name: Dynamic Antenna Array Steering
mechanical_systems.description: Fast, precise actuators for adjusting antenna array geometry in real-time, enabling beamforming and interference cancellation.

mechanical_systems.name: Self-Healing Fiber Optic Cables
mechanical_systems.description: Fiber optic cables with embedded sensors and actuators that automatically detect and repair minor damages.

software_integration.name: Network Slice Management Platform (NSMP)
software_integration.description: A cloud-based platform for defining, provisioning, monitoring, and managing network slices.

software_integration.name: Digital Twin Environment
software_integration.description: A 3D virtual representation of the network, enabling simulation, optimization, and troubleshooting.

software_integration.name: Blockchain-Based Service Level Agreement (SLA) Management
software_integration.description: Smart contracts automatically enforce SLAs and resolve disputes.

key_research_areas: Secure and Trustworthy Blockchain for Network Management
